FuncDef: The clock wtr command sets the wait-to-restore (WTR) time for a clock source. The clock wtr command sets the wait-to-restore (WTR) time for a clock source. By default, the WTR time of a clock source is 5 minutes. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H-48S6CQ, CE6881H-48S6CQ-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the WTR time for a clock source.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 12, in minutes. The default value is 5.
